item.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E914)

item.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

summary.text: Calls on: (1) the President to request former President Jimmy Carter, and members of the Carter Center, to assist the Office of Reconstruction and Humanitarian Assistance for Postwar Iraq (ORHA) to oversee the establishment of an interim Iraqi government; (2) the former President to forge a peaceful, cooperative, structure among Iraq's political, religious, and ethnic factions to facilitate the establishment of an interim government there; and (2) the Director of ORHA, retired U.S. Army General Jay Garner, to utilize the expertise and experience of the former President and Carter Center members in the establishment of such government.

bill.title: Calling on the President to request former President Jimmy Carter, and members of the Carter Center, to assist the Office of Reconstruction and Humanitarian Assistance for Post-War Iraq (ORHA).

item.title: Calling on the President to request former President Jimmy Carter, and members of the Carter Center, to assist the Office of Reconstruction and Humanitarian Assistance for Post-War Iraq (ORHA).

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
